name: fermentation
content:

a process of chemical change in food or drink because of the action of yeast or bacteria, which may cause it to produce bubbles or heat, or turn sugars in it into alcohol: Ethanol is an alcohol produced by fermentation of sugars. Fermentation takes about 48 hours. See
ferment
More examplesFewer examplesDifferent flours require different fermentation periods.The pale cloudy appearance is due to a second fermentation in the bottle.Add the yeast with the flour and water to start the fermentation process.

Alcoholic fermentation is a type of anaerobic respiration (= a chemical change without the use of oxygen) in which sugar is changed into alcohol and carbon dioxide (= a gas)
